plans.hookIdea: POV: You just spent 6 hours mixing your track and it still sounds like [show muddy waveform]
beats: Hook: Show frustrated producer with headphones
Pain point: Side-by-side comparing pro track vs muddy mix
Agitation: Show multiple failed attempts/tweaks
Problem statement: 'Spent $$$$ on plugins but still sounds amateur'
Solution tease: RiffRight interface analysis
CTA: 'Try free for 14 days (link in bio)'

Don't compare to specific professional releases
Keep focus on analysis features, not just AI mastering

plans.hookIdea: POV: You finally finish your track at 3am and it sounds FIRE... until you play it in your car the next morning
beats: Hook: Relatable moment of track sounding different on other speakers
Agitate: Show frustration - bass is gone, vocals are buried, sounds amateur
More pain: 'Meanwhile every other song on Spotify sounds perfect'
Introduce RiffRight: 'This AI literally shows you what's wrong'
Quick demo: Upload track, get instant mix analysis visual
CTA: '14 day free trial, link in bio'
complianceNotes: Avoid saying 'sounds exactly like Spotify tracks' - use 'compete with' or 'compare to'
Ensure we don't claim it replaces learning mixing skills

plans.hookIdea: I spent $300 on mastering engineers last month... then I found this
beats: Hook: Confession about spending money on mastering
Before state: Show uploading track that sounds flat/amateur
The discovery: 'RiffRight analyzes everything - EQ, dynamics, stereo width'
Transformation moment: Side-by-side comparison visual with before/after waveforms
Specific result: 'My tracks actually sound loud enough now without distorting'
Added benefit: 'Plus I'm learning WHY my mixes were off'
Social proof element: 'Been using it for 3 weeks, already released 2 tracks'
Soft CTA: 'Free trial for 14 days, I'll drop the link'
complianceNotes: Ensure before/after comparison is honest and not exaggerated
Don't claim it sounds identical to $300 mastering - focus on 'professional-grade' or 'competitive quality'
Personal results should include 'my experience' framing

scripts.raw:

{
  "angle": "pain_agitation",
  "duration": 30,
  "hook": "POV: You finally finish your track at 3am and it sounds FIRE... until you play it in your car",
  "storyboard": [
    {
      "t": "0-3s",
      "shot": "Creator sitting in car, excited expression turning to confusion/horror as they listen",
      "onScreen": "POV: playing your track in the car the next morning",
      "spoken": "So I stayed up until 3am finishing this track and it sounded absolutely perfect in my headphones",
